header: Cri.Bail Application no. 112/2019 CNR No. MHPU01-000439-2019

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. no. 67/19 registered at Wakad Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354A,354D,341,504,506 of the Indian Penal Code and under section 11,12 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012.

legalAct.actName: The Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act
legalAct.actShortNameList: POSCO,Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act

arguments.text: It is alleged that father of victim lodged report stating that on 04.01.2019 his elder daughter i.e. victim told that on 03.01.2019 she, her friend and her sister were returning from school by walking, applicant followed them and obstructed their road, when victim asked the reason, applicant abused them and threatened to see her if she did not talk with him, he hold her hand and outraged her modesty .

argumentSentences.text: It is alleged that father of victim lodged report stating that on 04.01.2019 his elder daughter i.e. victim told that on 03.01.2019 she, her friend and her sister were returning from school by walking, applicant followed them and obstructed their road, when victim asked the reason, applicant abused them and threatened to see her if she did not talk with him, he hold her hand and outraged her modesty .

arguments.text: 3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter. Offence punishable under section 11 and 12 of POCSO Act is not attracted to him. He is earning member of family and residing at Pawan Nagar, Pune. Investigation is practically over. He has no criminal antecedents. He is ready to abide the conditions. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

argumentSentences.text: 3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter.
Offence punishable under section 11 and 12 of POCSO Act is not attracted to him.
He is earning member of family and residing at Pawan Nagar, Pune.
Investigation is practically over.
He has no criminal antecedents.
He is ready to abide the conditions.
Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

arguments.text: 4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Statement of victim under section 164 of Cr.P.C. is yet not recorded. Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses. Applicant will repeat the offence. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. So, they prayed to reject the application.

argumentSentences.text: 4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress.
Statement of victim under section 164 of Cr.P.C.
is yet not recorded.
Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses.
Applicant will repeat the offence.
There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence.
So, they prayed to reject the application.

arguments.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is 2 Cri.Bail Application no. 112/2019 CNR No. MHPU01-000439-2019 interrogated. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Family members of applicant are depending on him. Applicant is resident of Pawan Nagar, Pune. He has no criminal antecedents. No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period. Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­

argumentSentences.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious.
Applicant is 2 Cri.Bail Application no. 112/2019 CNR No.
MHPU01-000439-2019 interrogated.
Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over.
Personal custody of applicant is not required.
Family members of applicant are depending on him.
Applicant is resident of Pawan Nagar, Pune.
He has no criminal antecedents.
No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period.
Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­

order.text: ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Vikas Tanaji Kambale be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.25,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution witnesses in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend Wakad Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not meet, harass, threat and pressurize the victim and shall not enter into vicinity of residence of victim. 6] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 7] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number.

footer: Pune. (R.V.Adone) Date – 10.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Pune. 3 Cri.Bail Application no. 112/2019 CNR No. MHPU01-000439-2019 “ I affirm that the contents of the P.D.F. File Judgment are same word for word as per original judgment. Name of Steno ­ S.V.Thakar, Court Name ­ Smt. R.V.Adone, Addl.Sessions Judge,Pune. processedText:
Cri.Bail Application no. 112/2019 CNR No. MHPU01-000439-2019 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. no. 67/19 registered at Wakad Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354A,354D,341,504,506 of the Indian Penal Code and under section 11,12 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012. 
---background-ends---
It is alleged that father of victim lodged report stating that on 04.01.2019 his elder daughter i.e. victim told that on 03.01.2019 she, her friend and her sister were returning from school by walking, applicant followed them and obstructed their road, when victim asked the reason, applicant abused them and threatened to see her if she did not talk with him, he hold her hand and outraged her modesty . 
---argument-ends---
3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter. Offence punishable under section 11 and 12 of POCSO Act is not attracted to him. He is earning member of family and residing at Pawan Nagar, Pune. Investigation is practically over. He has no criminal antecedents. He is ready to abide the conditions. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Statement of victim under section 164 of Cr.P.C. is yet not recorded. Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses. Applicant will repeat the offence. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. So, they prayed to reject the application. 
---argument-ends---
5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is 2 Cri.Bail Application no. 112/2019 CNR No. MHPU01-000439-2019 interrogated. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Family members of applicant are depending on him. Applicant is resident of Pawan Nagar, Pune. He has no criminal antecedents. No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period. Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­ 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Vikas Tanaji Kambale be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.25,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution witnesses in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend Wakad Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not meet, harass, threat and pressurize the victim and shall not enter into vicinity of residence of victim. 6] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 7] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number. 
---order-ends---
Pune. (R.V.Adone) Date – 10.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Pune. 3 Cri.Bail Application no. 112/2019 CNR No. MHPU01-000439-2019 “ I affirm that the contents of the P.D.F. File Judgment are same word for word as per original judgment. Name of Steno ­ S.V.Thakar, Court Name ­ Smt. R.V.Adone, Addl.Sessions Judge,Pune. Date of Order ­ 10.01.2019 Order signed by P.O. ­ 11.01.2019 Order uploaded on ­ 11.01.2019
